intro: Hypocalymma tenuatum, commonly known as the slender hypocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, woody fruits known as capsules. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Hypocalymma tenuatum is a valuable species for ecological studies due to its unique floral structure and habitat preferences.
